ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I believe I have polished Advanced-Mid Japanese, and can confidently say that I exist somewhere in Advanced-High. This course, through its readings, has given me depth into Japanese Pop Culture, Japanese Education, Japanese History, and more. Overall, it continued to hone my conversational abilities, as well as reading.

I learned a lot about nuanced topics in Japanese culture, like the education system and religion. I also learned a lot more vocabulary and grammar to be able to hold discussions about said topics. My speaking skills also improved greatly.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: You learn a lot more Japanese, so much more! I came back from a study abroad, and thought I was gonna lose the momentum on my Japanese learning, but this class really honed my Japanese more. Weaknesses: None!

Strengths: The class really emphasizes speaking. We constantly had conversation practice in class time, discussing our readings or using new grammar points. We also had a lot of presentations, which were nerve-wracking but very helpful. The topics we discussed were very relevant and engaging. We learned much about Japanese culture, which is really helpful for people who plan to study abroad or work in Japan. 

Weaknesses: I wish we learned more grammar. We learned only about four new grammar points each lesson. The textbook has much more than that, but the explanation and example sentences were often not comprehensive enough, so I wish we went over them in class as well.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you wish to improve your Japanese. Plain and simple!

Yes! The Japanese department is wonderful, and it is really worth it to continue studying Japanese. This course works on a lot of the important skills for living in Japan: cultural awareness, listening comprehension, and speaking fluency.
